content.question: Couples in early modern Europe generally put off marriage until they were, on average, in their mid- to late twenties because

choices.label: sexual maturation was delayed until the mid-twenties because of poor nutrition
they were concerned about scarcity of housing
they needed to acquire land or learn a trade before they could support a family
the customs and mores of a society dominated by religion promoted sexual restraint
laws prohibited marriage without parental permission before the age of majority

content.answer: they needed to acquire land or learn a trade before they could support a family

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
